project.description:
Copy packages from Devel:Cloud:Head to Devel:Cloud

ONLY FOR SUSE Cloud 1.0
use openstack-submit-project for 2.0 and up

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: SUBPROJECT
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: Which subproject should be submitted. Head for Devel:Cloud:Head or Crowbar for Devel:Cloud:Crowbar

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
# remove accidentally added spaces SUBPROJECT=${SUBPROJECT// /}
if [ $SUBPROJECT = "None" ] ; then echo "No valid SUBPROJECT provided - defaults for safety reasons to 'None'" echo "Provide either of: Head|Crowbar" exit 1 fi
OSC="osc -A https://api.suse.de" SUBPROJECT=${SUBPROJECT:-Head} DC=Devel:Cloud submitcmd="echo This job is for CLOUD 1.0 ONLY. But you tried to run it with: cloudsource=$cloudsource ; exit 1" [ "$cloudsource" = develcloud ] && submitcmd="$OSC copypac -K -e" [ "$cloudsource" = develcloud1.0 ] && DC=Devel:Cloud:1.0 && submitcmd="$OSC submitreq -m 'jenkins-submit-DCS'" DCS=$DC:$SUBPROJECT export IBS_CHECKOUT=/home/jenkins/IBS_CHECKOUT/$DCS
for COMPONENT in `$OSC ls $DCS 2>/dev/null` do cd $IBS_CHECKOUT cd $COMPONENT || exit 1 # disabling this for the moment, as it also skips when changes are made manually # if $OSC up 2>/dev/null | grep -v "^At revision" | grep -q . # then # echo "Warning: Changes detected in $COMPONENT. Thus skipping!" # continue # fi
grep -q "<linkinfo" .osc/_files || exit 2
if $OSC rdiff $DC $COMPONENT $DCS | grep . && $OSC api /build/$DCS/SLE_11_SP2/x86_64/$COMPONENT/_status | grep -q 'code="succeeded"' then $submitcmd $DCS $COMPONENT $DC fi done
